The importance of studying history The importance of the study of history lies in the fact that history is one of the most important elements upon which any society depends in its development or its decline, and that history has a close relationship with various sciences. The fate of the previous nations, as well as their interest in genealogies and incidents of time, and in the following points we mention the importance of studying history in general: studying history helps to know people and their contemporaries, and it is important in identifying names without error in the event that those names are similar. The study of history helps learn the transcriber and transcriber, as it contributes to clarifying new news from the old. It is history that bears witness to the past and the present, and what the future can be. The importance of studying history lies in taking a lesson and learning from the past, avoiding making mistakes that were in the past, and trying to find solutions to these mistakes. Through the study of history, we can know the truth of events and facts and their authenticity. History helps to know the history of the narrators and their journey in seeking knowledge and the narrator's state of truth or falsehood. When studying history, we can know the state of nations of strength or weakness, and also we can know the extent of ignorance or knowledge of nations, their activity or stagnation. When studying history, we can be inspired by the good role models that history highlights for us, which have had a great impact on life and are unforgettable role models over time.
